H0.text: who warned europe to stay out of the americas. James Monroe

H1.text: who warned europe to stay out of the americas. Thomas Jefferson

H2.text: who warned europe to stay out of the americas. Simon Bolivar

H3.text: who warned europe to stay out of the americas. Monroe Doctrine

A4.text: The United States would not accept the recolonization of any country by its former European master, and European countries should no longer consider the Western Hemisphere open to new colonization.

A5.text: Monroe articulated what became known as the Monroe Doctrine.

A6.text: Because the United States lacked both a credible navy and army at the time of the doctrine's proclamation, it was largely disregarded by the colonial powers.

A7.text: The doctrine was enforced in part by the United Kingdom, who used it as an opportunity to enforce its own Pax Britannica policy.

A8.text: Monroe promulgated the Monroe Doctrine, which declared that the U.S. would remain neutral in European affairs, but would not accept new colonization of Latin America by European powers.

A9.text: The United States was able to 'free ride' on the strength of the British Royal Navy.
